climate_variable.comment: Source: [Meinshausen et al. (2011)](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z) for 1850-2005 and [Dlugokencky & Tans (2019)](https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/) from 2006-2019.
Source: [Malte Meinshausen et al. (2016)](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-2016-169) for 1850-2014 and [Ed Dlugokencky (NOAA/GML)](https://gml.noaa.gov/ccgg/trends_ch4/) for 2015-2019.

Source: [Cecil, Daniel J. 2006. LIS/OTD 0.5 Degree High Resolution Monthly Climatology (HRMC)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303). Dataset available online from the NASA Global Hydrology Resource Center DAAC, Huntsville, Alabama, U.S.A.

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3a simulation round
simulation_round.description: Historical model evaluation and attribution runs

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3b simulation round
simulation_round.description: GCM-based simulations assuming fixed 2015 direct human influences for the future

variable.comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.
Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.
Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Grid cell mean depth of snowpack.
Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell.
Calculated from daily thaw depths.

Soil type as used by your model. Please include a description of each type in the model documentation (under "Other data sets used"). Please also include a link to a database/paper describing the parameters and values associated with these soil types.
Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

variable.comment: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

variable.comment: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation.

Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool in each layer

variable.comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation.
variable.long_name: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (plant) Respiration on Land

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land

variable.comment: Total C emitted from all fires (including deforestation and peat fire C emission).
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to C Emission from Fire

variable.comment: Report <total> daily, <pft/total> monthly

This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land

variable.comment: For wood products only. Sum of carbon fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emissions from previous years.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Land Use Change

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Grazing

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation to Litter

variable.comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

variable.comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.

The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.
The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
Includes sublimation.
At the surface of the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.
variable.long_name: Sensible Heat Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface

variable.comment: Albedo of the land surface interacting with the atmosphere. Average of pfts, snow cover, bare ground.
Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.
variable.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change

variable.comment: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from peatland fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.
variable.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Peat Fire

variable.comment: C emitted from peat fires (if simulated). Should also be part of ffire.
C emitted from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of ffire.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change

variable.comment: If calculated, weighted by burned area. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
(between 0 and 1), fraction of fuel combusted in a fire. Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
variable.long_name: Combustion Completeness of Different Fuel Classes

variable.comment: As a fraction of fuel dry mass (not percentage). Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
variable.long_name: Fuel Moisture for Different Fuel Classes

variable.comment: 95th percentile of number of fires in one day during the month
Fraction of area covered by trees
Monthly mean weighted with the number of fires of each day
95th percentile of fire size computed during the month
Mean needs to be weighted with the number of fires
Mean needs to be weighted with burned area
variable.long_name: Weighted Mean Fire Rate of Spread

variable.comment: Mean height of canopy formed by trees over 5m.  Vegetation of less than 5m should be excluded from the canopy height calculation (i.e. not contributing with zero)
Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation less than 5 m tall
Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation more than 5 m tall
Grid cell total.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land

variable.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire.
variable.long_name: Total Nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (including NHx, N2O, N2) from fire

variable.comment: Refers to secondary bioenergy crops and should not be included in fcropharvest-total. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Bioenergy Harvesting

product.title: Input Data
product.description: The data used to drive the impact models, exactly as described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Input Data
product.description: Data that have been derived from or are related to the input data, but not described in the simulation protocol (e.g. with a differnt spatial or temporal resolution).

product.title: Output Data
product.description: The climate-impacts simulation data provided by participating modelling groups, corresponding to the output variables described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Output Data
product.description: Data that have been derived by processing the ISIMIP output data, but do not correspond to output variables described in the simulation protocol.

geo_dataset.comment: This is the land-sea mask of the W5E5 dataset ([Cucchi et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-2097-2020); [Lange et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.342217)). Over all grid cells marked as land by this mask, all climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. For further information see also <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/41/>.

This is the generic land-sea mask from ISIMIP2b that is to be used for global water simulations in ISIMIP3. It marks more grid cells as land than **landseamask**. Over those additional land cells, the climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are not guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. Instead they may represent climate conditions over sea or a mix of conditions over land and sea.
Country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.
Fractional country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.

One fixed pattern to be used for all simulation periods. Upscaled Soil texture map (30 arc sec. to 0.5°x0.5° grid) based on Harmonized World Soil Database v1.1 (HWSD, <https://www.fao.org/publications/card/en/c/2fa14e5e-ae97-516e-9dd2-24bc7abbc823/>) using the GSWP3 upscaling method A (<http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~sujan/research/gswp3/soil-texture-map.html>)

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

geo_dataset.comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on all land.

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

geo_dataset.comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on current cropland ([MIRCA2000 at 5 arc-minutes](https://doi.org/10.1029/2008GB003435)).

geo_dataset.title: basins
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

geo_dataset.title: flowdir
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

geo_dataset.title: slopes
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

datasets.comment: Factual climate input datasets: GSWP3-W5E5, 20CRv3-W5E5, 20CRv3-ERA5, 20CRv3.

Tracks from IBTrACS database ([Knapp et al. 2010](https://doi.org/10.1175/2009BAMS2755.1)) (period 1841-2021), Windfields calculated by Holland model ([Holland 1980](https://doi.org/10.1175/1520-0493(1980)108%3C1212:AAMOTW%3E2.0.CO;2), [Holland 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/2008MWR2395.1)).
Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303).
GFDL MOM6/COBALTv2 simulations driven by reanalysis-based atmospheric forcing ([Liu et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.1029/2021GL094367)).
Hourly coastal water levels with long-term trends for impact attribution.
1850-2005: [Meinshausen et al. (2011)](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z), 2006-2021: [Dlugokencky & Tans (2022)](https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/)
1850-2014: [Meinshausen et al. (2017)](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-10-2057-2017), 2015-2021: [Dlugokencky (2022)](https://gml.noaa.gov/ccgg/trends_ch4/)
Detrended versions of the GSWP3-W5E5, 20CRv3-W5E5, 20CRv3-ERA5, 20CRv3 data sets derived by the Attrici method.

We do not provide "no climate change" TC tracks and windfields but the original tracks from the IBTrACS database ([Knapp et al. 2010](https://doi.org/10.1175/2009BAMS2755.1)) (period 1841-2021) windfields calculated by Holland model ([Holland 1980](https://doi.org/10.1175/1520-0493(1980)108%3C1212:AAMOTW%3E2.0.CO;2), [Holland 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/2008MWR2395.1)) should be used in combination with the counterfactual water levels to estimate the impacts of sea level rise on TC induced damages, losses or replacement.

We do not provide "no climate change" lightning data. Instead the original Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303) should be used in the **counterclim** set-up.
We do not provide any counterfactual oceanic forcings, i.e. there is no "no climate change" experiment proposed for the fisheries and marine ecosystems sector.
Detrended version of the **obsclim** hourly coastal water levels.
1901 levels ([CO2] = 296.13 ppm) of observed atmospheric CO2 concentrations according to [Meinshausen et al. (2011)](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z).
1901 levels of atmospheric CH4 concentrations ([CH4] = 928.8004 ppb), according to [Meinshausen et al. (2017)](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-10-2057-2017).

bias_adjustment.description: Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.
Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).

soc_scenario.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period.
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

datasets.comment: HYDE-based irrigated and rainfed cropland downscaled to up to 15 crops, managed pasture and grassland, urban areas. The data originates from the historic [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)) and the Monfreda data set ([Monfreda et al, 2008](https://doi.org/10.1029/2007GB002947)).

Historical annual country-level wood harvesting data based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).

Historical annual land-use transformation data, based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).

Historical annual fertilization rates, based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).
NHx and NOy deposition simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI), see [Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.759077.1).
Observation-based representation of recent average planting and maturity dates not accounting for changes over time ([Jägermeyr et al. 2021](https://www.nature.com/articles/s43016-021-00400-y)).
Adopted from [Rousseau et al. (2019)](https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1820344116).

The data is based on [Lehner et al. (2011a)](https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK), [Lehner et al. (2011b)](https://doi.org/10.1890/100125), and Jida Wang et al. (KSU/Kansas State University, personal communication, data starting in 2016). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications.

For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by the WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08 models (1850-202118). This data is based on ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project ([Wada et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-175-2016)) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

Lake and reservoir area fraction/percentage calculated from the Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://www.nature.com/articles/ncomms13603)) and GRanDv1.3 databases ([Lehner et al., 2011](https://esajournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1890/100125))
Observed stem numbers, thinning type, planting numbers from and common management practices for 9 forest sites in Europe from [Reyer et al. (2020)](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-1295-2020).

National and gridded historical population data. Estimates are available for total as well as urban and rural population counts. The population data are adopted from HYDE v3.3 (private communication with K. Klein Goldewijk, to be published).
Based on the [World Development Indicator database (WDI)](https://databank.worldbank.org/source/world-development-indicators).

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-2015 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

soc_dataset.title: Landuse totals

variables.long_name: share of managed pastures or rangeland

soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information on the land use data refer to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/82/>.

soc_dataset.title: Downscaling to 5 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated C3 annual crops
share of rainfed C3 annual crops
share of irrigated C3 perennial crops
share of rainfed C3 perennial crops
share of irrigated C3 N-fixing crops
share of rainfed C3 N-fixing crops
share of irrigated C4 annual crops
share of rainfed C4 annual crops
share of irrigated C4 perennial crops
share of rainfed C4 perennial crops

soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Downscaling to 15 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated Oil crops groundnut
share of rainfed Oil crops groundnut
share of irrigated Oil crops rapeseed
share of rainfed Oil crops rapeseed

soc_dataset.comment: The C4 perennial crops are not further downscaled from the "5 crops" data set and currently only include sugarcane.  Similarly, the C3 perennial crops are not downscaled either. The data is derived from the "5 crops" LUH2 data, and the crops have been downscaled to 15 crops according to the ratios given by the Monfreda data set ([Monfreda, Ramankutty, and Foley, 2008](https://doi.org/10.1029/2007GB002947)).

soc_dataset.title: Managed pastures and rangeland
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Urban areas
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Nitrogen deposited by fertilizers on croplands

variables.long_name: N input through fertilizer on cropland with C3 annual crops

soc_dataset.comment: Based on the LUH2 v2h data set (see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/28/>.

soc_dataset.title: Reduced nitrogen deposition
soc_dataset.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 ([Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1)). Data for 2015-2021 is assumed to be same as that in 2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

soc_dataset.title: Oxidized nitrogen deposition
soc_dataset.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 ([Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1)). Data for 2015-2021 is assumed to be same as that in 2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

soc_dataset.title: Wood harvesting

variables.long_name: wood harvest area from primary forest land
wood harvest area from primary non forest land
wood harvest area from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest area from secondary young forest land
wood harvest area from secondary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary young forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary non forest land

soc_dataset.comment: Historic annual country-level wood harvesting data. Based on the LUH2 v2h Harmonization Data Set ([Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). Interpolated to a 0.5° grid using first-order conservative remapping and calculated over a fractional country mask (<https://gitlab.pik-potsdam.de/isipedia/countrymasks/-/blob/master/>) derived from [ASAP-GAUL](https://data.europa.eu/euodp/data/dataset/jrc-10112-10004). For further information see <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/83/>

soc_dataset.title: Population (gridded)
soc_dataset.comment: Historical population data are based on the 2019 Revision of the United Nations World Population Prospects ([United Nations, 2019](https://population.un.org/wpp/)). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

soc_dataset.title: Population (country-level)

variables.long_name: total number of people per country

soc_dataset.comment: Historical population data are based on the 2019 Revision of the United Nations World Population Prospects ([United Nations, 2019](https://population.un.org/wpp/)). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

soc_dataset.title: GDP
soc_dataset.comment: Historic country-level GDP data are based on GDP per capita estimates from the WDI (1965-2020). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

dimensions.long_name: Depth of Vertical Layer Center Below Surface

harmonization.title: Default
harmonization.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

harmonization.title: Fully harmonized
harmonization.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmonization.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmonization.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated. Please contact the sector coordination to push on with this side branch.

forest_stand.title: Hyytiälä
forest_stand.comment: Note that an experimental plot of pine contains a lot of data while footprint of flux tower is larger. Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

forest_stand.title: Peitz
forest_stand.comment: Managed using a weak thinning from below.

forest_stand.title: Kranzberg Roof Project
forest_stand.comment: Unmanaged/ thinning from below in past 20 years for all species.

sens_scenario.description: For all experiments other than the sensitivity experiments.
CO₂ concentration fixed at 1901 levels as a deviation from the “obsclim” climate + CO₂ forcing.
Simulation with fire switched off to identify impact of fire within the model.

category.title: Climate related forcing
category.description: Forcing data describing physical or chemical systems, in particular the climate, the oceans, and the cryosphere.

category.title: Static geographic information
category.description: Geographic or other time-independent information, such as land-sea masks, or river routing networks.

category.title: Direct human forcing
category.description: Independent additional forcing data, which influence climate impacts, such as land-use, population or economic changes.
